page.title: 13OLD HOUSES IN S. HEDINGHAM
page.content: {Mrs.Weatherly's house}was built in 1750. It has wooden beams and the walls are mostly made of wattle and daub but parts are Tudor brick. The floors upstairs are oak. The roof is covered with peg tiles. In the{house}they have a huge fireplace which used to be bricked up but now the men have knocked it out and it is bigger. There is a salt dry to keep the salt in. The{house}used to have a shop at the front. It used to sell hats and then it became a general store. It was built on to the{house}in 1890 and it closed in 1977. Mrs.Weatherly has found many old coins,the earliest was dated 1775. Outside their{house}there is a well that is about 40 feet deep,which has a board across the middle to stop you falling down.
